name: Food for Thought? Quiz | Word Play | 5 Questions

questions.text:
A canine with a fever, I am not.

In a roll I'm tasty - eat the lot.
questions.explanation:
Hot Dog.

	Canine with a fever is a dog with a high temperature = Hot Dog.

questions.text:
First you must break me before you can eat.

With bacon for breakfast I'm such a treat.

The stuff of which castles are made on the coast.

Add a crone or a hag - I'm a snack you can toast.
questions.explanation:
Sandwich.

	The first line alludes to sand castles.A crone or hag is another name for a witch.

questions.text:
Not flowers for your sweetheart, but the product thereof.

Could 'bee' a sting in the tale, go careful my sweet love.
questions.explanation:
Honey.

	The first line hints toward the nectar of the flower. Line two 'bee a sting in the tail' hints at the nectar collector - the bee. Honey is often used as a pet name for a loved one.

questions.text:
I wager you'll solve this one - that's a safe bet.

Rare to well-done - that's the choice you get.
questions.explanation:
Steak.

	The first line is a play on the word stake, to make a bet or wager. The second line hints toward the various degrees of cooking a steak.
